alert.note: Alert for Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:50PM EST until February 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Cass River At Frankenmuth affecting Saginaw County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cass River At Frankenmuth. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river begins to overflow its banks in places, flooding adjacent low lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
